note.p: Death: The Elms, Sutton Bonnington, Nottinghamshire (04 July 1899)
Education: Trinity College, Dublin. MD (1841, Edinburgh)

Career: Assistant Surgeon, Royal Navy (1842); Surgeon (1849); Surgeon and Naturalist on board HMS Investigator, seeking the North West Passage (until 1853); Inspector of Fleets and Hospitals (1858); Chief of Hospital, Malta (1859-1864); Inspector General (1866), then Director General of the Medical Department of the Navy (1869-1871); Honorary Physician to the Queen and to HRH The Prince of Wales.
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 50-51 signed by M F
